title: Bênçãos Que Não Têm Fim (Counting My Blessings)
licensing_note: Lyrics via Musixmatch API; translations via Google Translate API; grammar notes auto-generated placeholders.

lines.text: Ainda me lembro quando um milagre eu pedi
lines.translation: I still remember when I asked for a miracle.
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Ainda me lembro quando um milagre eu pedi' → 'I still remember when I asked for a miracle.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.text: Com pouca fé, sim, eu temi
lines.translation: With little faith, yes, I was afraid.
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Com pouca fé, sim, eu temi' → 'With little faith, yes, I was afraid.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.text: E hoje eu posso ver, foi muito além do meu pensar
lines.translation: And today I can see, it went far beyond what I had imagined.
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'E hoje eu posso ver, foi muito além do meu pensar' → 'And today I can see, it went far beyond what I had imagined.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.translation: There are so many blessings to recount.
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'São tantas bênçãos pra contar' → 'There are so many blessings to recount.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Um, dois, três' → 'One two three'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Bênçãos que não têm fim' → 'Blessings that never end.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Perco as contas' → 'I lose count.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.text: E agradeço o que fez por mim
lines.translation: And I appreciate what you did for me.
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'E agradeço o que fez por mim' → 'And I appreciate what you did for me.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.translation: God, I have so many blessings.
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Deus, eu tenho tantas bênçãos' → 'God, I have so many blessings.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.translation: I can see in my life
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Posso em minha vida enxergar' → 'I can see in my life'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.translation: The more I see the details
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Quanto mais vejo os detalhes' → 'The more I see the details'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Sua bondade posso encontrar' → 'I can find your kindness'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.translation: Father, and as long as I live
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Pai, e enquanto eu viver' → 'Father, and as long as I live'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Sempre irei me lembrar' → 'I will always remember.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Ainda que sejam infinitas' → 'Even though they are infinite'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Suas bênçãos, eu irei contar' → 'I will count your blessings.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.text: E nenhuma fase dura para sempre
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'E nenhuma fase dura para sempre' → 'And no phase lasts forever.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.text: Por isso, eu não vou me esquecer
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Por isso, eu não vou me esquecer' → 'That's why I won't forget.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.

lines.text: Cada motivo que tenho pra ser grato
lines.translation: Every reason I have to be grateful.
lines.grammar: Portuguese line: Note verb conjugations, nasal vowels, and pronoun placement with clitics/enclisis. Key phrase: 'Cada motivo que tenho pra ser grato' → 'Every reason I have to be grateful.'. Mention tense/person endings and any idiomatic chunk the learner should memorize.
